definitions.definition: important in history; likely to be thought of as important at some time in the future

examples.text: Take a tour of historic sites in the old city.
It was a great fight, a historic moment in Irish sport.
Murals depict the region's historic events.
The area is of special historic interest.
The party has won a historic victory at the polls.

definitions.definition: of a period during which history was recorded
that took place in the past but was not dealt with at the time

examples.text: There is still more to be done to right the historic injustice of slavery.
The tribunal will consider historic claims dating back to 1840.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent. (in the sense ‘relating to or in accordance with history’): via Latin from Greek historikos, from historia ‘narrative, knowing by enquiry’, from histōr ‘learned, wise man’, from an Indo-European root shared by wit ‘have knowledge’.
